description:
8.28 afwtdn
Reduce broadband noise from input samples using Wavelets.

A description of the accepted options follows.

adaptive.description: If enabled, input frames are analyzed for the presence of noise. If noise is detected with high possibility, then the input frame profile will be used for processing following frames, until a new noise frame is detected.

levels.description: Set the number of wavelet levels of decomposition. Allowed range is from 1 to 12. Default value is 10. Setting this too low makes denoising performance very poor.

percent.description: Set percent of full denoising. Allowed range is from 0 to 100 percent. Default value is 85 percent or partial denoising.

profile.description: If enabled, the first input frame will be used as noise profile. If the first frame samples contain non-noise, performance will be very poor.

samples.description: Set size of single frame in number of samples. Allowed range is from 512 to 65536. Default frame size is 8192 samples.

sigma.description: Set the noise sigma. Allowed range is from 0 to 1. Default value is 0. This option controls the strength of denoising applied to input samples. Most useful way to set this option is via decibels, e.g., -45dB.

softness.description: Set softness applied inside thresholding function. Allowed range is from 0 to 10. Default softness is 1.

wavet.description: Set wavelet type for decomposition of input frame. Available wavelets are: sym2, sym4, rbior68, deb10, sym10, coif5, bl3.
